elements.title: a 1958 advertising slogan
elements.contents: ... that many British people refer to one-pint milk bottles as "pintas" because of a 1958 advertising slogan (pictured)?

elements.title: KIVA-TV
elements.contents: ... that New Mexico television station KIVA-TV received angry phone calls and a bomb threat after switching away from a tied football game?

elements.title: Rudolf Pohl
elements.contents: ... that conductor Rudolf Pohl, a member of the Aachen Cathedral choir as a boy, brought the Charlemagne-era choir to international recognition in the 1960s?

elements.title: Volkswagen worker organizations
elements.contents: ... that on initiative of the Volkswagen worker organizations, Volkswagen formed one of the first Global Works Councils in 1998, an extension of the existing European Works Council?

elements.title: Lou Swarz
elements.contents: ... that Lou Swarz became famous for her "One Woman Show" involving monologue performances as various characters, including Phillis Wheatley and Sojourner Truth?

elements.title: Monmouth Coffee Company
elements.contents: ... that Monmouth Coffee Company in Covent Garden was one of the foundations for the third wave of coffee in London?

elements.title: Juan Juárez
elements.contents: ... that Juan Juárez may have been the first bishop-elect within the territory of the United States?

elements.title: Friends
elements.contents: ... that the leader of the Japanese band Friends was chosen via a game of Uno?
